info.title: Process Mining API
info.description:
This API provides a collection of services to get information and statistics about projects and manage their lifecycle. ## **Finding the API URL** Creation of the REST API URL depends on the deployment type of Process Mining.
In case of native deployment, the root URL to invoke the API and to open the Process Mining WUI are the same.
In case of containerized deployment on RedHat OCP, the API URL is provided in the Status section of the CRD. The following CLI command can be used to retrieve the API URL: 
oc get processmining  -o jsonpath={..status.components.api..uri}'
## **Using the REST API** All the API requests must include a JWT Bearer token in the Authorization header except for the two APIs listed below, where the token is included in the API request body:

*1. /integration/export/{projectKey}/decision-rules
2. /connectors/integration/bai/import*

The existing clients can still include the authentication token as query parameter, even if it's deprecated and will be removed in a future release.

It's possible to generate an authentication token by providing the API Key and the API account, which are provided in the **User Profile** view of the Process Mining user interface.

The JWT token will expire in 30 minutes so the client should generate a new token to authenticate the API calls after 30 minutes.

See the following curl command to generate the JWT token:

**curl -X 'POST' \
'https://__/integration/sign' \
-H 'accept: application/json' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-d '{
"uid": "__",
"apiKey": "__"
}'**

where __ is the domain name of the Process Mining environment, __ is the User ID for the Process Mining application, and __ is the API Key provided in the **User Profile** view of the Process Mining user interface.

get.description: This API request retrieves the current server time (in milliseconds) that  acts as the base time for the other API requests.
get.summary: Get the Server time

get.description: This API request generates an OTP authentication token for a web  connection to Process Mining. </br> This API is Deprecated and will be removed in a future version.
get.summary: Get a web authentication token (Deprecated).

post.description: This API request generates the JWT token that is required for the authentication of the REST API calls.

get.description:
This API request retrieves the workflow of the process as SVG.
The returned workflow will reflect the level of detail that is currently set in the project settings.

parameters.name: viewType
parameters.description:
Workflow view selector, legal values are:
   0 - Frequency view
   1 - Performance view (Avg)
   2 - Performance view (Max)
   3 - Performance view (Min)
   4 - Performance view (Median)
   5 - Rework view
   6 - Performance view (Weighted)
   7 - Cost view
   8 - Overall cost view

data.example: 

value.data: Project with name <projectKey> not found in organization <org>

post.description: This API request performs the business rules mining algorithm on the target project to generate a new set of business rules associated to the BPMN Model. </br> This API launches an asynchronous processing: the caller receives the acknowledgment, if the request was successfully forwarded to the pipeline, or an error message, if a problem was found in the input data. </br> In case of success the response will contain the job key that can be used to inquiry the status of the request through the job-status API (/integration/decision-rules/job-status/{jobKey}).

value.data: Project with name <projectKey> not found in organization <org>

post.summary: Generate and export the business rules for a process

post.description: This API request uploads a new dataset to an existing project. </br> This API will not automatically refresh the current event log nor the linked snapshots: to include the new dataset in the process analysis you must call the “Generate the Event Log” API. </br> This API will launch an asynchronous processing: the caller receives the acknowledgment, if the request was successfully forwarded to the pipeline, or an error message, if a problem was found in the input data. </br> In case of success the response will contain the job key that can be used to inquiry the status of the request through the job-status API (/integration/csv/job-status/{jobKey}).

parameters.name: forUpdate
parameters.description: Project Append/Ovverride (leave it empty for append)

parameters.name: dataSetOverride
parameters.description: Dataset Append/Ovverride (leave it empty for append)

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Dataset description (if empty, dataset description fallbacks to file name)

value.data: Project with name <projectKey> not found in organization <org>

post.description: This API request performs the process mining algorithm on the target project to generate a new event log based on the uploaded data. </br> The “mapping” parameter is optional if the field mapping has already been set by WUI, otherwise it's required.  </br> This API will launch an asynchronous processing: the caller receives the acknowledgment, if the request was successfully forwarded to the pipeline, or an error message, if a problem was found in the input data. </br> In case of success the response will contain the job key that can be used to inquiry the status of the request through the job-status API (/integration/csv/job-status/{jobKey}).

parameters.name: forUpdate
parameters.description: Eventlog Append/Ovverride (leave it empty for ovveride)

post.description: This API request performs the reset of the target project. </br> This API will launch an asynchronous processing: the caller receives the acknowledgment, if the request was successfully forwarded to the pipeline, or an error message, if a problem was found in the input data. </br> In case of success the response will contain the job key that can be used to inquiry the status of the request through the job-status API (/integration/csv/job-status/{jobKey}).

value.data: Project with name <projectKey> not found in organization <org>

post.summary: Reset a project (Async)

post.description: This API request performs the trimming of the target project. </br> This API will launch an asynchronous processing: the caller receives the acknowledgment, if the request was successfully forwarded to the server pipeline, or an error message, if a problem was found in the input data. </br> In case of success the response will contain the job key that can be used to inquiry the status of the request through the job-status API (/integration/csv/job-status/{jobKey}).  </br> Please note that an empty body is accepted, but it will not produce any result because no filters are actually provided.

requestBody.description: The request body must contain a json object like the one illutsrated in the example.</br> The caseFilters section contains the filters used to select the cases to keep in the project. </br> The entityFilters section contains the filters used to keep a subset of the removed cases. </br> Please note that the filter expression refers the filters array by index, starting by 0. </br> The filters provided in the example will remove all cases including invoices cleared before March 2021 while keeping all purchase orders that are still open.

caseFilters.expression: ((0 OR (1 AND NOT 2)) OR (3 AND NOT 1) OR (4 AND NOT 1))

value.data: Project with name <projectKey> not found in organization <org>

post.summary: Trim a process according to parameters (Async)

requestBody.description: The request body must contain a json object like the one illustrated in the example.</br>

post.description:
This API request performs the data import from Elastic Search to the target project. </br> This API will launch an asynchronous processing: the caller receives the acknowledgment, if the request was successfully forwarded to the pipeline, or an error message, if a problem was found in the input data. </br> In case of success the response will contain the job key that can be used to inquiry the status of the request through the job-status API (/integration/bai/job-status/{jobKey}).  </br> </br>
The following attributes are required in the request body: </br>  - uid </br> - ts </br> - sign </br> - bpmProcessApplicationName </br> - startInterval </br> - endInterval </br> </br> At least one of projectTitle or projectName must be provided: if the project is not existing, it will be automatically created in the target organization before data uploading. otherwise data will be added to the existing project. </br> If the orgKey attribute is empty the project will searched or created  as a private projects of the user who is executing the request.

value.data: Can not get project, Project title is null AND Project name is null

post.summary: Import Process Data from Elastic Search (Async).

get.description: This API request retrieves the list of widgets included in the dashboard identified by the dashboard Id and included in the  project identified by the project key.
get.summary: Get the list of widgets in a dashboard inside a process.

get.description: This API request retrieves the values shown by the widget identified by the widget title inside the dashboard identified by the dashboard Id and contained in the project identified by the project key (Please note that only tabular widget are supported). Please note that this API will NOT consider the filters applied to the dashboard.
get.summary: Get the values shown by a tabular widget inside a process.

post.description: This API request posts a query to get results from the Advanced Analytics component in IBM Process Mining. If the API posts an invalid query, the Analytics component returns an error.
post.summary: Executes the user-created custom query that is similar to an SQL query.

post.description: This API request posts a query to get the jobId from the Advanced Analytics component in IBM Process Mining. </br> In case of success, the response will contain the job key that can be used to inquiry the status of the request through the job-status API (/analytics/integration/jobs/query/{jobId}). </br> If the API posts an invalid query, the status of the request through the job-status API will be ERROR.
post.summary: Executes the user-created custom query that is similar to an SQL query (Async).

post.description:
This API request performs the export of all dashboards included in the projects owned by the requesting user. </br> The exported data will be stored in the filesystem or in a S3 bucket, depending on the configuration. </br> The configuration parameters related to dashboard export are: </br> * *pm-analytics.export.enabled* - To enable/disable the export (true/false), default false </br> * *pm-analytics.export.destination* - Export destination (fs/s3), default fs</br> * *pm-analytics.export.notifyToEmail* - Email address for notification</br> * *pm-analytics.export.fs.baseDir* - Base path for fs export</br> * *pm-analytics.export.s3.bucket* - Bucket name for S3 export</br> * *pm-analytics.export.s3.region* - AWS Region for S3 export</br> * *pm-analytics.export.s3.accessKeyId* - AWS key id for S3 export</br> * *pm-analytics.export.s3.secretKey* - AWS secret key for S3 export </br>
This API will launch an asynchronous processing: the caller receives the acknowledgment, if the request is successfully forwarded to the pipeline, or an error message, if a problem has been found in the input data. </br> In case of success the response will contain the job key that can be used to inquiry the request status through the job-status API (/integration/bai/job-status/{jobKey}).  </br>
post.summary: Export the dashboards in a project (Async).

get.description: This API request performs the export of a dashboard included in the project owned by the requesting user.</br> The exported data contains only the table widgets in the dashboard and can be stored in the user specified location.
get.summary: Export a dashboard.

delete.description: This API request deletes all users in a tenant. </br> The response contains the list of deleted users. </br> This API can only be called by users who have permission of Tenant Admin for the tenant containing the users to delete.
delete.summary: Delete all users belonging to a tenant.

delete.description: This API request deletes a user account. </br> The response contains all details of the deleted users. </br> This API can only be called by users who have permission of Tenant Admin for the tenant containing the user to delete.
This API request deletes a tenant. </br> You can call this API only if you have the MultiTenant Admin permissions.

post.description: This API request creates a tenant. </br> You can call this API only if you have the MultiTenant Admin permissions.
post.summary: Create a tenant.

get.description: This API request lists all tenants. </br> You can call this API only if one of the following conditions are adhered:</br> * Your user account has the MultiTenant Admin permissions. </br> * Your user account has the Tenant admin permission and your user account belongs to the tenant for which the API is used.
get.summary: Get the details of all tenants.

get.description: This API request lists a tenant. </br> You can call this API only if one of the following conditions are adhered:</br> * Your user account has the MultiTenant Admin permissions. </br> * Your user account has the Tenant admin permission and your user account belongs to the tenant for which the API is used.
get.summary: Get the details of a tenant.

patch.description: This API request updates a tenant. </br> You can call this API only if one of the following conditions are adhered:</br> * Your user account has the MultiTenant Admin permissions. </br> * Your user account has the Tenant admin permission and your user account belongs to the tenant for which the API is used.

delete.description: This API request deletes a tenant. </br> You can call this API only if you have the MultiTenant Admin permissions.

delete.description: This API request deletes all the users in a tenant.</br>
delete.summary: Delete all users in a tenant.

get.description: This API request lists a user in a tenant.</br>
get.summary: Get a user in a tenant.

patch.description: This API request updates a user in a tenant. </br>
patch.summary: Update a user in a tenant.

delete.description: This API request deletes a user in a tenant. </br>
delete.summary: Delete a user in a tenant.

post.description: This API request creates a user group when called by users with the admin or group_admin role.
post.summary: Create a group.

get.description: This API request retrieves the list of user groups under a tenant when called by users with the admin or group_admin role.
get.summary: List of groups.

delete.description: This API request deletes a user group when called by users with the admin or group_admin role.

post.description: This API request creates an authorization for a user group or user when called by users with the admin or group_admin role.
post.summary: Create an authorization.

get.description: This API request retrieves the list of authorizations for a tenant when called by users with the admin or group_admin role.
get.summary: List of authorizations of a tenant.

get.description: This API request retrieves the list of authorizations for a group.
get.summary: List of authorizations for a group.

get.description: This API retrieves the list of authorizations of a user.
get.summary: List of authorizations of a user.

patch.description: This API updates the permissions of an existing authorization.
patch.summary: Update the permissions of an authorization.

delete.description: This API request deletes an authorization when called by users with the admin or group_admin role.

post.description: This API request adds a user to a group when called by users with the admin or group_admin role.
post.summary: Adds a user account to the group.

get.description: This API request retrieves the list of users in a group.
get.summary: List of users in a group.

delete.description: This API request removes a user from the group when called by users with the admin or group_admin role.

tags.name: Connector IBM BAI
tags.description: Requests regarding integration with IBM BAI.

useCachedRules.description: Flag to use the cached rules, if true the existing rules will be returned, otherwise a new rule mining will be triggered (default false)

updateSettings.description: Flag to update the decision rules settings, if true the provided settings will override the existing settings, otherwise they will be used only for this invocation  (default false)

dmnOutputVariableName.description: Name of the output variable used in the decision tables

settings.description: The settings to be used for decision rules mining, only the attributes with value true will be used in the computation

org.description: Organization Key (leave it empty for private projects)

value.description: Value can be any Json value (objects, arrays, numbers, strings ...).

description.example: This is an organization for tutorial

query.example: SELECT ACTIVITY, count(*), FILTERED_CASES as MEASURE_0 FROM dual GROUP BY ACTIVITY

templateId.description: The unique Id of the filter template.

query.example: SELECT CASEID FROM EVENTLOG GROUP BY CASEID
query.description:
This represents the SQL query that requires execution.
If the column name in the SQL query contains a hyphen, the name must be enclosed in backslashes and quotes. For example, '\"TOTAL-AMOUNT\"'.

targetDate.description: The date upto which the data will be displayed.

activitiesConformance.description:
When you select Activity in the Dimension field in an Analytics Widget, you can select one of the following options to filter the activities per conformance to a reference model,
- Show all (Default option)
- Keep conformant activities
- Keep not conformant activities

keepLast.description: When keepLast is true, only the last value before the specified date is considered for the selected measures.

backPeriod.description: Backward period in days; if the 'from' attribute is null or empty, this period is applied the current date (or to the 'to' attribute if present).

projectOwner.description: User Id of the project owner.

projectTutorial.description: Indicates whether the project is tutorial or not. If 'yes', the project is a tutorial. If 'no', the project is not a tutorial.

projectSnapshot.description: Indicates whether the project is the snapshot of an existing project or not. If 'yes', the project is a snapshot. If 'no', the project is not a snapshot.

projectMultiLevel.description: Indicates whether the project is multi-level or not. If 'yes', the project is multi-level. If 'no', the project is not multi-level.

projectTotalCaseCount.description: Total count of cases in the project.

projectTotalEventCount.description: Total count of events in the project.

projectBusinessHours.description: The business hours of the project.

projectExcludeWeekends.description: Indicates whether the project excludes weekends or not. If 'yes', the project excludes weekends. If 'no', the project does not exclude weekends.

projectRefModel.description: Indicates whether the project has a reference model or not. If 'yes', the project has a reference model. If 'no', the project does not have a reference model.

country.description: Country of the user. You must ensure that the value adheres to the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 standards.

technicalUser.description: Describes whether or not the user is a technical user.

apiKey.description: API key of the user account.

active.description: Describes whether an account is active or not.

blocked.description: Describes whether an account is blocked or not.

accountId.description: Account ID of the user account..

password.description: This field is mandatory if the identity provider is Process Mining instead of SAML, LDAP, or OCP IAM.

DashboardZipFile.description: A successful response exports a zip file having files in .csv format that contains the exported data.

BackupFile.description: This produces a binary file which can be downloaded using .idp extention

KpiSettings.description: KPI settings for the process and activities

ProcessKpiSettings.description: KPI settings related to the process

ActivityKpi.description: KPI settings related to the activities

name.description: This refers to the different types of KPIs. Among these KPIs, case-throughput and case-cost are process related KPIs and activity-throughput, activity-duration, activity-wait-queue, and resource-allocation are activity related KPIs.

totalCases.description: Count of the total cases in a process

totalEvents.description: Count of the total events in a process

filteredCases.description: Count of the filtered cases in a process

filteredEvents.description: Count of the filtered events in a process

minThroughputTime.description: Minimum throughput duration in milliseconds of a process

maxThroughputTime.description: Maximum throughput duration in milliseconds of a process

avgThroughputTime.description: Average throughput duration in milliseconds of a process

stdThroughputTime.description: Standard throughput duration in milliseconds of a process

medianThroughputTime.description: Median throughput duration in milliseconds of a process

minRunningThroughputTime.description: Minimum running throughput duration in milliseconds of a process

maxRunningThroughputTime.description: Maximum running throughput duration in milliseconds of a process

avgRunningThroughputTime.description: Average running throughput duration in milliseconds of a process

stdRunningThroughputTime.description: Standard running throughput duration in milliseconds of a process

minCompletedThroughputTime.description: Minimum completed throughput duration in milliseconds of a process

maxCompletedThroughputTime.description: Maximum completed throughput duration in milliseconds of a process

avgCompletedThroughputTime.description: Average completed throughput duration in milliseconds of a process

stdCompletedThroughputTime.description: Standard completed throughput duration in milliseconds of a process

minArrivalRate.description: Minimum number of cases in a day in a process

maxArrivalRate.description: Maximum number of cases in a day in a process

avgArrivalRate.description: Average number of cases in a day in a process

minTime.description: Start time of the first activity in a process

maxTime.description: End time of the last activity in a process

totalStandardCost.description: Total standard cost of an activity

totalResourceCost.description: Total resource cost of an activity

Edge.description: Statistics of a relation between activities

ProcessGraph.description: This schema contains an array of activities and activity relations along with the activities after Start in a process

ProcessModel.description: This contains graph and analysis of a process

ProcessModelResponse.description: Response of the process model statistics API

NodeResponse.description: Response of the single activity statistics API

EdgeResponse.description: Response of the relation statistics API

data.description: The job id to retrieve the results

RunningCaseFilter.description: Filter for filtering the running or completed cases

filterType.description: The type of filter used for filtering the running or completed cases

excludeCases.description: Operator to exclude running cases or completed cases. If you select "running", you exclude Running Cases. If you select "completed", you exclude Completed Cases.

ConformanceCaseFilter.description: Filter to be applied to filter conformant/not-conformant cases

filterType.description: Filter type for filtering conformant/not-conformant cases

excludeCases.description: Operator to exclude conformant or non-conformant cases. If you select "nonConformance", you exclude Non-conformant Cases. If you select "conformance", you exclude Conformant Cases.

SimulatedCaseFilter.description: Filter to be applied to filter simulated or as-is cases

filterType.description: Filter type for filtering simulated or as-is cases

excludeCases.description: Operator to exclude simulated or as-is cases. If you select "simulated", you exclude Simulated Cases. If you select "asIs", you exclude as-is cases.

CustomMetricFilter.description: Filter for viewing the process model based on the condition set for a Custom Metric.

filterType.description: Type of a Custom Metric filter.

label.description: Description of the Custom Metric filter.

customMetricDatatype.description: The type of data that a Custom Metric provides.

operator.description:
Operators for the Custom Metric filter:

* If customMetricDataType is BOOLEAN/STRING, you can select ‘equals’ (E) or ‘not equals’ (NE) as the operator.       
* If customMetricDataType is DOUBLE, you can select ‘greater than (GT)’, ‘greater than or equal to (GTE)’, ‘less than (LT)’, ‘less than or equal to (LTE)’, ‘equal to (E)’, or ‘not equal to (NE)’ as the operator.        
* If customMetricDataType is DATE, you can select ‘greater than (GT)’, ‘greater than or equal to (GTE)’, ‘less than (LT)’, ‘less than or equal to (LTE)’, ‘equal to (E)’, ‘not equal to (NE)’, or ‘between (BW)’ as the operator.

customMetricEndValue.description: Value defined for the end date of the Between (BW) operator, in the DATE customMetricDataType.

AttributeFilter.description: Filters process based on the event attribute

attributeValue.description: Value of the event attribute specific to a project

attributeKey.description:
Value of an existing default/custom event attribute of the project.

If the value is "activity", it is considered as an Activity filter.

If the value is not "process", it must not contain operator, timeValue or timeUnit.

Examples for default event attributes are: 
* process
* activity
* resource
* role

matchCases.description: If the value is "true", include the matched cases. If the value is "false", exclude the matched cases.

timeSpanFrom.description: Start date in the format yyyy-mm-dd

matchingRule.description: Operator to match filter anywhere within a case, at the start of a case, or at the end of a case

timeSpanTo.description: End date in the format yyyy-mm-dd

operator.description: Operator to indicate durations that are more than or less than timeValue

KPIFilter.description: Filter to be applied based on one or more KPI rules

retainCritical.description: Retain KPI-critical cases if true or Retain cases within KPI boundaries if false

PatternFilter.description: Filter to be applied based on a specific process flow pattern

attributeKey.description:
Value of an existing default/custom event attribute of the project.

Examples for default event attributes are: 
* process
* activity
* resource
* role

pattern.description:
Process Flow Pattern used by the filter are as follows: 
 * \<A>.\*\<B> ------- B follows A
 * \<A>\<B>   -------   B directly follows A
 * \<A>.\*\<B>.\*\<C> -------  C follows A and B
 * (\<A>.*){2,} ------- at least a rework of activity A
 * (\<A>.\*\<B>.*){2,} ------- at least a rework of A to B path

where A, B and C are activities.

matchCases.description: If the value is "true", include the matched cases. If the value is "false", exclude the matched cases.

matchingRule.description: Operator to match filter anywhere within a case, at the start of a case, or at the end of a case

operator.description: Operator to indicate durations that are more than or less than timeValue

OutlierFilter.description: Filters events based on the outlier configuration and filtering level

label.description: Descriptive label for the outlier filter

outlierLevel.description: Level of the outlier filter from Strong (0.0) to Weak (5.0)

range.description: Filter selection type of lower, upper or both

matchCases.description: If the value is "true", include the matched cases. If the value is "false", exclude the matched cases.
If the value is "true", include the matched cases. If the value is "false", exclude the matched cases.

multiProcess.description: Indicates if the filter is MultiProcess (if the value is true) or Single Process (if the value is false)

RelationFilter.description: Filter to verify if an activity directly follows the other

matchCases.description: If the value is "true", include the matched cases. If the value is "false", exclude the matched cases.

ReworkFilter.description: Filter to be applied if there is rework for an activity

matchCases.description: If the value is "true", include the matched cases. If the value is "false", exclude the matched cases.

ThroughputFilter.description: Filter applied on the basis of throughput for a specific duration

operator.description: Operator to indicate durations that are more than or less than timeValue

matchCases.description: If the value is "true", include the matched cases. If the value is "false", exclude the matched cases.

startTime.description: Start date in the format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssXXX

endTime.description: End date in the format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssXXX

matchCases.description: If the value is "true", include the matched cases. If the value is "false", exclude the matched cases.

VariantFilter.description: Filters activities based on a case variant

variant.description: Filter a process based on Variant IDs. **Important:** To select multiple Variant IDs, separate each Variant ID using the pipe operator, | .

matchCases.description: If the value is "true", include the matched cases. If the value is "false", exclude the matched cases.

DiscardFilter.description: Filter to discard a particular activity from a process.  **Important:** DiscardFilter is not available in the list of filters in the input field of the transient filters.

activity.description: Activity name selected to apply discard filter

ScriptFilter.description: Filter to apply the custom business logic using JavaScript.  **Important:** ScriptFilter is not available in the list of filters in the input field of the transient filters.

matchCases.description: If the value is "true", include the matched cases. If the value is "false", exclude the matched cases.

templateId.description: The unique ID of the filter template.

name.description: The name of the filter template.

filters.description: The filters present in the filter template.

owner.description: The owner of the filter template.

shared.description: Specifies whether the filter template is shared within the organization.

KpiLevel.description:
Shows the possible level of mismatches:
  * warning - When the ```warningThreshold``` kpi is breached
  * critical - When the ```criticalThreshold``` kpi is breached

JobStatus.description:
Status for the jobs submitted to execute in background:
  * complete - Marks the job as completed processing
  * pending - Indicates that the job is yet to start
  * in_progress - Indicates that the job has started
  * stopping - Indicates that the job is ending
  * error - Indicates that the job has an error
  * canceled - Indicates that the job is canceled

Variant.description: An entity of the Case variants

id.description: Unique ID of the Case variant

subProcessFrequency.description: Subprocess frequency of a Case variant that is related to the process ID of a multiLevel process

ratio.description: ratio of number of cases in a Case variant to total number of cases in a process

avgDuration.description: Average duration of a Case variant

activityNames.description: List of activities in a Case variant

steps.description: Count of the distinct activities in a Case variant

minTime.description: Start time of the first activity in the Case variant

maxTime.description: End time of last activity in the Case variant

totalCost.description: The total cost of activities in a Case variant

avgCost.description: The average cost of activities in a Case variant

subProcess.description: Sub-process of a Case variant related to the process ID of a multilevel process

totalElements.description: Total number of Case variants for the process

pageSize.description: Maximum number of Case variants that can be displayed in the current page

source.example: var customMetric = {kpi: function(trace) {var myCustomCaseCost = 0;for(var k = 0 ; k < trace.size(); k++) {var event = trace.get(k); if(event.getEventClass() === 'Request created') {myCustomCaseCost += 1;}else if(event.getEventClass() === 'Evaluating Request (NO registered letter)') {myCustomCaseCost += 3;}}return myCustomCaseCost;}};
source.description: The custom script that is used to create a custom metric.

originalName.description: The name of the custom metric provided by the user.

metricName.description: The name of the custom metric to be used in Filters.

metricType.description: The type of the custom metric.

showCustomMetricStatistics.description: Toggle to show or hide the statistics of the custom metric in the Model tab, Statistics tab, and Compare tab.

invalid.description: Indicates if the custom metric is valid or not.

unit.description: Unit of the custom metric result that must be displayed in the Model tab, Statistics tab, and Compare tab.

metricDescription.example: My custom cost of the process
metricDescription.description: The description of the custom metric.

categoryName.description: The name of the custom metric category provided by the user.

categoryDescription.example: Category that group custom metrics based on the amount.
categoryDescription.description: The description of the custom metric category.

name.description: A name to identify the process backup.

includedTypes.description: The components that are added to the backup.

backupId.description: A unique ID for the process backup.

status.description: 'INCOMPLETE' happen when is needed to run a mining in order to obtain an updated model; 'MINING_IN_PROGRESS' when there is a mining ongoing; 'READY' when there is a model and no mining ongoing; 'ERROR' when an error occurred during the last mining.

message.description: General message in accordance to the project status.

owner.description: If an `owner` is entered, it is possible to work in multi-tenancy mode.

defaultCurrency.description: The selected currency is used as the default value in the project.

customColumnLimit.description: The number of custom columns that can be mapped in a project.

passwordPolicy.description: This is not valid when the product configuration uses an LDAP, SAML, or OCP IAM identity provider.

maxHistoryDepth.description: The maximum number of passwords saved in the history. This ensures that the user does not reuse an earlier password.

maxAge.description: The maximum number of days for password expiration.

maxLength.description: The maximum length of the password.

minLength.description: The minimum length of the password.

minDigit.description: The minimum number of digits that a user can include in a password.

minSpecialCharacter.description: The minimum number of special characters that a user can include in a password.

minUpperCharacter.description: The minimum number of uppercase letters that a user can include in a password.

minLowerCharacter.description: The minimum number of lowercase letters that a user can include in a password.

lockingAccountPolicy.description: This is not valid when the product configuration uses an LDAP, SAML, or OCP IAM identity provider.

enabled.description: Use the `enabled` toggle to enable the lock policy.

maxPasswordFailuresNumber.description: The maximum number of consecutive attempts that is available for the user after entering an incorrect password. If the user enters an incorrect password more that the number defined in the field, `maxPasswordFailuresNumber`, the user is locked out of the account.

maxPasswordFailuresTimeFrame.description: The time interval for committing maximum number of password failures.

lastLoginMaxAge.description: The maximum interval of time from the latest login.

id.description: The unique ID of the user.

email.description: The email id of the user.

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

lastName.description: The last name of the user.

computeDurationInBusinessHours.description: Set computeDurationInBusinessHours to On if the IBM Process Mining application must compute the duration (service and waiting time of the process) by using only the defined business hours.

excludeWeekends.description: Set excludeWeekends to On if the application must exclude Saturdays and Sundays when it computes service and waiting time. Set excludeWeekends to Off if the application must include Saturdays and Sundays when it computes the service and waiting time.

businessHours.description: Mention the defined time range that the application must consider as the business hours instead of 24 hours. You must use the 24-hour time format when you define the business hours.

selectedCalendars.description: Build and manage calenders for the process.

automatedFieldTruthValue.description: The attribute that describes the automatic events from the manual events.

automatedActivityAttribute.description: Define the value of the automated activity attribute box that identifies the automatic events.

customExcludedFields.description: One or more custom attributes that you want to exclude from the compliance analysis, root-cause analysis, and influencers.

timeZoneOffset.description: Value that represents dates by using the chosen time-zone offset.

defaultPage.description: Use this parameter to set the default page of the IBM Process Mining application. You can set this parameter to either `Model` or `Analytics`. When you select Model, IBM Process Mining directs you to the process visualization in the Model page whenever a process is selected. When you select Analytics, IBM Process Mining directs you to the process visualization in the Model page whenever a process is selected.

displayReferenceActivities.description: When displayReferenceActivities is set to On, IBM Process Mining does not hide the reference model activities, even when you set the activity complexity to 1%.

keepDefinedRoles.description: When keepDefinedRoles is set to On, IBM Process Mining maintains any role-resource manual assignments that are made on the Social Network whenever you upload a new data source for the process.

projectCurrency.description: The value of currency used in the project.

enableRunningTime.description: When you set enableRunningTime slider to On, the Refresh button on the Model page is enabled whenever you select the Running Cases filter for a process.

modelRelationDetails.description: The percentage of relations between the activities. By increasing this percentage, less frequent paths become visible, allowing a more detailed (although less readable and user-friendly) process visualization.

modelActivityDetail.description: The percentage of visible activities. A low percentage of detail makes the model display only the most frequent activities.

blueWorksliveProcess.description: Name of the blueWorklive processes that are integrated with IBM Process Mining.

defaultBucketLimit.description: The defaultBucketLimit API is used by the process analysis to split timeline in buckets and make calculations about concurrency, bottlenecks, and parallelisms.

ActivityCostListResponse.description: Response of the ActivityCost settings API.

type.description: Define whether the cost value refers to manual activity, the automatic activity, or both.

endDate.description: Define the date until which the specified cost must be applied to the activity. You must define the date in ISO Date format in UTC.

ResourceCostListResponse.description: Response of the resource cost settings API.

endDate.description: The date until which the specified cost must be considered for the resource. You must define the date in ISO Date format in UTC.

ActivityWorkingTimeListResponse.description: Response of the Activity Working Time settings API.

type.description: Define the type of the activity, for example, automatic or manual.

value.description: Time duration for the activity in hours.

endDate.description: End date until which the specified working time must be applied to the activity.You must define the date in ISO Date format in UTC.

RoleCostListResponse.description: Response of the Role Costsettings API.

endDate.description: Define the date until which the specified cost must be considered for the role. You must define the date in ISO Date format in UTC.

userId.name: uid
userId.description: API Account (Deprecated, it can still be present but is no longer used for authentication and will be permanently removed in a future release)

userIdForReplace.name: userIdForReplace
userIdForReplace.description: User Id to take ownership of objects linked to the deleted user (if not provided the objects are deleted as well)

force.name: force
force.description: Flag to force deletion when the user owns some objects

serverTime.name: ts
serverTime.description: Timestamp in milliseconds (Deprecated, it can still be present but is no longer used for authentication and will be permanently removed in a future release)

sign.name: sign
sign.description: API Signature (Deprecated, it can still be used to provide the JWT Token but it will be removed and permanently replaced by the Bearer Token in the 'Authorization' header in a future version)

organization.name: org
organization.description: Organization Key (leave it empty for private projects)

measure.name: measure
measure.description: Measure of different duration values of an activity or a relation which is used to compute the KPI mismatch.

size.name: size
size.description: Maximum number of Case variants that needs to be displayed in the current page

attributeKey.name: attributeKey
attributeKey.description: This API retrieves statistics of Case variants related to an attribute. You can select a default or custom attribute to view the statistics of Case variants. If the **Model** represents a multilevel process, you can view the statistics of Case variants linked to multiple **Process id**s (for example, **process-1, process-2, process-3** and so on). By default, the API provides the statistics of Case variants related to the **Case structure** attribute.

sortBy.name: sortBy
sortBy.description: Sort the statistics of Case variants by throughput or frequency

order.name: order
order.description: This API orders the Case variant statistics by the highest to lowest values of frequency or throughput.

groupId.name: groupId
groupId.description: The unique id of the group to be deleted.

accountId.name: accountId
accountId.description: The unique id of the user for which the authorizations needs to be listed.
